ratings.comment: Not specific at all. You ask for help and he just says you did it wrong. Doesn't explain anything. Practice tests weren't like the real test.

This is/was an online course, and I loved it. I was fine going at my own pace, and learning by myself. There's a discussion section, but it's not required and I honestly didn't find it useful. Wardrop was flexible with exam times and for when I needed to arrange a meeting.  Homework was graded on completion which is nice, but remember to read key.

This class wasn't as bad as it looks. His  Course Notes seem long but they're funny to read. To be honest the exams were a joke. All you need to do is look at the practice exams and nothing else. Do homework only for completion.
Not very direct

This course was online and it was great.  The practice tests were almost exactly like the actual tests.  Two midterms and a final.  Discussions were optional, but I went because they basically gave you the homework answers.  Homework was graded for effort.  It was a great class that took up minimal time.

The online blended course was kind of a joke. The course notes are written by Wardrop in a long-winded format that rarely gets to the point of the material in a direct way. This makes doing the weekly homework tedious and frustrating. I feel like I have not really learned any stats, let alone Biostats. Exams are sort of like practice exams.
Bob is really nice. I took the online section, and I really recommend it. He writes the text himself and it is really easy to understand. The tests are also super easy.

I didn't think I would enjoy Stats as much as I did. He wrote course notes that you could access for free that were far more interesting than any textbook I've ever read. I thought he was really funny and it made the class much more fun for me. This is an online class so there was a lot of reading but it was completely fair. I highly recommend it.
Online lectures. A lot of readings for lecture notes, no lectures nor videos. Exams are super easy!

Great professor! Online quizzes were tricky, and the exams were -not- exactly like practice exams. About 60-70% similar, but have to be careful to watch for changes in wording on the actual exams. To get above a 90 you need to understand concepts behind the equations in the very well laid-out course notes he provides for exam. Awesome guy, though.

Bob is literally one of the funniest professors I know. His quizzes are tough but manageable if you actually read the course notes. Practice exams are almost exactly the same as the actual ones. Homework is graded on completion/effort.

Bob is the man. Not only does the online section not require you to waste hundreds of dollars on a textbook, but it's his own (hilarious) notes catered exactly to his audience. He knows the course isn't for mathematicians, and makes the material very digestible. Flexibility of online is great, tests are easy, and projects are fun. Take this course.

Forget about all good comments. A nice guy who tries to help you, but that’s about it. NO lecture video. Have to read 40 pgs of * notes that talk nothing about biostat; take very tricky weekly quizzes (avg. 60-70.) Actual exams=70% based on practice exams. If you e-mail him about non-course stuffs, he will get mad so don’t bother. Curve is nice.

I took the blended course and I can honestly say that I have not learned a single useful thing about statistics.  The class is centered around confusing course notes that never really get to the point of what you need to know, and then the online quizzes are ridiculously difficult.  the exams arent too bad though.  ALSO, hes a super nice guy!

The course notes were very confusing and the blended class itself required an excessive amount of work. The weekly quizzes were very tricky, but the exams were similar to the practice exams. I still would not recommend this blended course because though it is supposed to be BioStats it had very little to do with biology and tests used in research.
Professor Wardrop was by far one of my favorite professors. He's extremely helpful and wrote his own "course notes." Exams are exactly like the practice tests.

He really wants his students to succeed, and spent lots of time helping in his office hours.  This class was his first online class, and the material was very boring.  Basically you read pages and pages of course notes, and the weekly quizzes online were timed and tricky.  But, the final exam was just like the practice final.  Nice guy!

Bob Wardrop is the man. If you are taking Stat 371, you MUST take it with him!!! He is extremely clear on his expectations and what you need to know, making the mid term and final a breeze. Highly recommend.

Class is boring, but easy. He makes the homework extra credit and the only assignment of the class, a probability assignment, is also extra credit. He's retired, so doesn't worry about giving too many A's; I think 35% of my class got A's. He doesn't use a text book, just sends out links to the pages. Great professor, boring class.
lecture is useless

Prof Wardrop is one of the best professors i've had at madison.  he is a funny, sweet old man and tells great stories that help you remember the material. very approachable and helpful in office hours. doesnt use a textbook but instead has "course notes" that he wrote himself - very good class for non-math people

the most enjoyable class I've ever had. He is really funny and approachable. Trying to make stats interesting. He clarified a lot of misconceptions most textbooks have. Tests are extremely easy. Just make sure you know how to do the practice exam. Lecture is really fun :)

Robert is the best professor ever! He is very generous about marks! always gives partial credits on questions, works on HWs during discussions and his exam questions are very similar to the practice questions, which he always goes over the day before the exam. If you can enroll in his class, YOU MUST! definitely an easy A class.

What can I say- it's the easiest "math" class I've ever taken. Only thing I wasn't so fond of was the class layout- there is no weekly preparation (the homework is completed in discussion and there are no quizzes), so I found it hard to keep up with the class. However, even if you cram right before the exams, you should be fine. He's a great guy.
Easy class. Exams just like practice exams.

He is a great professor and a good guy overall. Super easy class. He understands that Stats isn't all that important to most of us non-stat majors and teaches acordingly. He gave up using his textbook because he felt bad making students buy a book that they didn't really need. If you have to take a stats class take it with Bob.

All you need to do is read the notes he types up for lecture, and then attend lecture to make sure you understand it. Apparently, the publishing company didn't like his book so he bought all of the remaining copies (which means not enough for everyone), so no textbook. He likes to tell lots of anecdotal stories. Exams are multiple-choice equations.
THE MAN CITES THE MOVIE OCTOPUSSY IN HIS TEXTBOOK!  WHAT MORE NEEDS TO BE SAID?  A+++

Bob was a great guy. Always had funny examples and stories. He explained everything you needed to know in lecture. Discussion useful for going over hw problems. Exams open book/notes so not too hard; however they are lengthy and cover a lot of material so you actually have to know what you're doing if you want to finish and do well.

If you are taking this class over the summer, take it with Bob. You don't have to pay attention to lectures, discussions have really nice, condensed handouts (which are good for exams: open notes and book) and projects are so easy. He has office hours every day, as well as the TA's. Easy way to raise GPA.

He is really nice and enthusiastic.  His exams are super fair: just do the practice exams and consolidate your equations.  Exams are open book and open note.  Discussion helps diminish homework time.  You don't have to attend lecture but gives good explanations.  Don't read the book and attend reviews.

If you have to take this class--take it with Bob. He makes the material understandable, the open note/book tests were not hard at all. My only complaint was that he wrote the book too so if you don't understand in lecture, don't expect to get a different explanation from the book.
This was by far the easiest class at Madison. Open book/open note exams, you have to try to not get a good grade

This was the easiest class I've taken in college.  The discussions are helpful, even though you don't have to go.  You do problems exactly like the ones on the exam.  Lectures are pretty boring.  Go to the reviews because he does problems that are exactly like what will be on the exam and tells you everything that will be on it.

I thought he was a very good professor. He used his own book which was nice, and was always willing to help students. If you do the work and know how to do the homework problems and practice exams you should get an A. 57% of our class earned As. He said he was retiring and not planning on teaching in the future though.

Easiest class you'll ever take. Bob is awesome, really laid back, funny, sarcastic, and grades the course so you get the best possible score. Minimal effort and you can get an A. He is retired but apparently teaches this class once in a while. Highly recommended!
This professor is awesome! He's funny and makes stats as interesting as possible. I'd definitely recommend him! also very easy if you do the work, he doesn't ask too much

This class was remarkably easy.  I never went to a single discussion, and stopped attending lecture at the end of the semester and just taught myself everything for the homework out of the book and studied the practice exams as they are almost exactly like the real exams.  I still got an A.  Take this class for stats, definitely.

Take this class if you can! It's super easy (as long as you do the work) and he is a fantastic guy.  He has a great sense of humor and really cares about his students.  Plus, you can't really beat open book exams!

Amazing professor.  Bob is makes stats interesting and clear.  He has a great sense of humor.  There isn't much math involved when he teaches stats.  He's retired but still teaches a lecture or two each semester.  Take stats with Bob if you can (even if it isn't a required class)!

Dr. Wardrop is an amazing professor.  Although he's retired, for now, he's still teaching a few sections a year.  He's so helpful, and he really cares about the students.  He also has a great sense of humor.
AMAZING PROFESSOR!!!!  He is really nice and is actually here to help students learn!  Statistics isn't so scary when it's taught by Wardrop.

One of the best profs at UW-Madison.  It's impossible to get worse than a B and he is very helpful.  Get to use notes on exams and practice exams are nearly identical to in-class exams.  He retires at the end of summer '06, so take him now!!!
Interesting sense of humor made class enjoyable, or at least as enjoyable as Stats can be. Exam review sessions were invaluable, as were practice exam questions.
if you have to take stats, take it with wardrop.  he actually managed to make a boring class like stats interesting!
He made the class seem as interesting as possible.  Tests were very easy if you did the practice problems.  The homework took almost no time at all!
if you want an easy math class take this. basically you can use all your notes on the exams and the curve is great
boring
EASY AS HELL!!!  Tells funny stories and EASY EXAMS!!!
He's ok. Probably the best for a boring class like stat. Has some annoying habits, but you cant get everything.

I hate math and I hate statistics, but I loved Wardrop.  He was funny, sincere, and self-effacing, and he made statistics, which must be those most boring thing this side of calculus, interesting.  Excellent professor!

This could possibly be one of the easiest classes at UW because all the tests are open book, open note and examples are done in class the day before the exam.  If you want to take stats, take Wardrop.
EASY
This professor is really good.
rambles in class, gives numerous clues on tests, really helpful, can't get a lower than a C in the class because he allows make up tests
He makes statistics as interesting as possible.  The time really flies in class.  Plus, it's open book open note tests!
Very sincere teacher. Very few teachers really care about their students, but he is one that does.
awesome prof with a great sense of humor anyone that takes his class is sure to walk away with a greater knowledge of the subject material.  TAKE HIS CLASSES!!!

bob was really great and makes sure that EVERYONE who works hard in the class passes. the class is not easy for some, but if you talk to the prof about problems he'll work with you. beware of the 301 TA's...very few were helpful to me.....
No Comments
good lecturer, tries to keep things interesting, attempts to be funny, concerned with students
